body:
Actually, this is because that the onnx model is generated by `Caffe2OpToOnnxNodes`, which will always generate raw tensor. 
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/6252706feb23e448bff944c3505092b18718d3ab/caffe2/onnx/onnx_exporter.cc#L77
body_html:
Actually, this is because that the onnx model is generated by Caffe2OpToOnnxNodes, which will always generate raw tensor.

pytorch/caffe2/onnx/onnx_exporter.cc

Line 77 in 6252706

TensorProto CreateOnnxShapeTensor(std::shared_ptr<DummyName> dummy, const std::vector<int64_t>& shape) {
